Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Structured Exercise in ERAS Protocols

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies reporting on postoperative complications, length of hospital stay (LOS), and overall recovery.

Intervention.evidence: Structured exercise interventions, such as aerobic activities and resistance training, were associated with reduced postoperative complications and shorter hospital stays.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of structured exercise within the Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) protocol on postoperative outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in LOS, measured immediately post-surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size for LOS reduction was a mean difference of 1.5 days (95% CI 1.0 to 2.0; p < 0.001).
